channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Kimmel and Colbert appear as guests on each other's shows
item.description: On Tuesday night, in New York City, they united in a special talk show crossover of Jimmy Kimmel Live! on ABC and The Late Show with Stephen Colbert o...

item.title: Government shutdown could delay key economic reports at an especially sensitive time
item.description: The federal government shutdown, which began overnight, will delay key reports on the U.S. economy, including a monthly snapshot of the job market, wh...

item.title: Fool me once: the magical origin of the word hoax
item.description: Frauds, swindles, cons, scams, and deceptions are collectively known as hoaxes. But there's more than meets the eye.

item.title: What happens now that the government has shut down. And, a pricing deal with Pfizer
item.description: The federal government has shut down for the first time since 2019. Mass layoffs have been threatened. And, President Trump announced a pricing deal w...

item.title: China's ride-hailing companies try to quell the smell in cars where some drivers sleep
item.description: China's ride-hailing car drivers work long hours to get enough fares, and often live in their cars. Companies and passengers are penalizing drivers fo...

item.title: Oktoberfest opening delayed in Munich after fatal fire and bomb threat
item.description: Mayor Dieter Reiter said the Oktoberfest would remain closed until early evening because of a bomb threat.

item.title: Government shutdown begins as nation faces new period of uncertainty
item.description: The government shutdown has begun. And itâ€™s plunging the U.S. into a fresh cycle of uncertainty. President Donald Trump and Congress failed to strike ...

item.title: Bomb threat shuts Oktoberfest in Munich after explosion, fire in home
item.description: Authorities in Munich say a bomb threat has shut down Germany's famed Oktoberfest after an explosion and deadly fire in a home nearby.

item.title: Man suspected of ordering murder of three Argentine women arrested
item.description: The brutal torture and killing of the three women in Argentina sent shockwaves through the region.

item.title: Moments as 6.9 magnitude earthquake hit Philippines
item.description: Moments as 6.9 magnitude earthquake hit Philippines

item.title: Democrats embrace a shutdown fight in a rare moment of unity against Trump
South African firebrand MP Malema convicted of firing a gun in public
item.description: Julius Malema, known for his incendiary rhetoric, was recently convicted of hate speech.

item.title: 8/27: CBS Morning News
item.description: President Trump says U.S. will seek the death penalty in all Washington, D.C. murder cases; Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's love story.

item.title: Activists say Gaza flotilla circled by Israeli warship
item.description: The Global Sumud Flotilla accused an Israeli vessel of steering "dangerously close" to one of its boats.

item.title: Venezuela poised to declare emergency after U.S. boat strikes
item.description: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro placed Venezuela on high alert over a major U.S. military deployment near his country's coast.

item.title: Bermuda gets glancing blow from Hurricane Humberto as it braces for Imelda
item.description: The outer bands of distant Hurricane Humberto were lashing Bermuda ahead of a more direct pass from the newer and stronger Hurricane Imelda.

item.title: Imelda approaches Bermuda as a Category 1 hurricane
item.description: Imelda, the ninth named storm of the 2025 Atlantic hurricane season, strengthened into a hurricane on Tuesday.

item.title: What happens now that a government shutdown is underway
